intro: Ozoxeta, commonly known as the white broom. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Rhamnaceae family, native to southern Africa. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, white flowers. Ozoxeta thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in shrublands and coastal areas. Its foliage is typically green and dense, providing habitat for various insects and small animals.
